settings.text: Located on the northeast shore of the eastern province of Cuba, Cayo Romano (formerly Cayo Cruz) Lodge offers a huge variety of salt water fly fishing. This newly formed fishery is surrounded by a marine park and offers an enormous and expansive system of flats, lagoons and pristine estuaries. Virtually untouched, this fishing location represents one of the cleanest and most biologically diverse ecosystems providing opportunities for catching bonefish, permit, tarpon, snook, and barracuda. The flats are an inviting combination of hard packed white sand and a semi-firm mottled bottom great for wade fishing. Spend the day wading or boat fishing the flats and then return to the  hotel for some rest and relaxation.

settings.code:
The Fishery

The first thing that guests need to know about when considering this location, aside from the exceptional flats fishing that is found here is that this new fishery is still very much in its infancy. The flats are an inviting combination of hard packed white sand and a semi-firm mottled bottom that still provides good wading. And what a place this is for those who like to wade! It‘s very similar to Los Roques in terms of the amount of area that‘s wadable and there are places here where you can wade for 4 straight hours without heading back to the boat.

settings.text:
The accommodations at Cayo Romano make this location ideal for anglers and non-anglers alike. Guests stay at a luxurious beach resort that is conveniently located across the road from the boat launch. For those that don’t want to fish, you can spend your time on white sand beaches or one of the resort's numerous relaxing swimming pools. When you return from a day on the water, there are multiple full service beverage bars as well as a wonderful variety of cuisine.

Cayo Romano offers an outstanding Cuban experience and some of the best flats fishing in the world!
